results.title: Sean Connery, Who Embodied James Bond and More, Dies at 90
results.abstract: To legions of fans who have watched a parade of actors play Agent 007, none played the part as magnetically or as indelibly as Mr. Connery.

multimedia.copyright: Donaldson Collection/Michael Ochs Archives, via Getty Images

des_facet: The Man Who Would Be King (Movie)
Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (Movie)
results.abstract: Whether as James Bond or Indiana Jones’s father, the Scottish star played the man’s man with an earthy sexiness, as these performances prove.
results.title: 15 Sean Connery Movies to Stream
results.byline: By Noel Murray and Scott Tobias

results.abstract: What’s more fundamental to scary movies than the bone-chilling shriek? But delivering a terrifying wail isn’t easy. It’s an entire art with a history and a world of its own.
results.title: They Scream! We Scream!

multimedia.caption: Susan Boyajian says there are “gradual screams, a buildup scream, kind of hyperventilating — say someone’s chasing you with a knife, and then you go into a scream.”
multimedia.copyright: Maggie Shannon for The New York Times

results.title: Stream These Vintage Heist Movies
results.abstract: Some of the most popular heist films of the last 25 years are remakes of beloved classics. Here’s where you can get away with streaming the originals, plus some other vintage-cool crooks.

results.title: TV’s Horror Hosts: 70 Years of Screams and Cheese
results.abstract: This Halloween, a new generation of hosts are keeping alive one of television’s oldest gimmicks: costumed goofballs presenting schlocky horror movies.

results.abstract: An outsider herself as a young woman, the director and actress wants teenage girls to relish a sense of community.
results.title: Zoe Lister-Jones on ‘The Craft’ and Women’s Power

multimedia.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times
multimedia.caption: Often films about teenagers with special powers focus on how overwhelmed they are, Lister-Jones said. “I don’t think that’s a message we need to be giving to young women anymore. I think the more power, the better.”

Often films about teenagers with special powers focus on how overwhelmed they are, Lister-Jones said. “I don’t think that’s a message we need to be giving to young women anymore. I think the more power, the better.”

results.title: David Guillod, Hollywood Executive, Arrested Again After Assault Report
results.abstract: Mr. Guillod was out on bail after he was charged earlier this year with sexually assaulting four women.

results.abstract: Despite the continued shutdown of the city’s movie houses, indie theaters just may survive: They are less reliant on Hollywood and have a loyal audience.
results.title: How New York’s Small Cinemas Are Hanging On

multimedia.copyright: Calla Kessler for The New York Times
multimedia.caption: Nick Nicolaou, who owns Cinema Village, and the people behind indie cinemas like Film Forum, Anthology Film Archives and Nitehawk remain in an uneasy limbo, desperate for audiences yet terrified of cinemas becoming petri dishes.

results.title: The ‘Purge’ Films Reveal the Ugly Truth About America
results.abstract: B movies often tell more honest stories about our society than finely calibrated award-season films do.
